arm_group.description: Subject defined as acceptable in the CPRD GOLD with at least one solid organ transplant rejection reported during the overall study period (01 September to 31 October 2010).

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims to assess the risk of solid organ transplant (SOT) rejection following
      vaccination with Pandemrix™ and/ or seasonal influenza vaccination.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assess the Risk of Solid Organ Transplant Rejection Following Vaccination With Pandemrix™ in UK

detailed_description.textblock:
Data on the safety of pandemic H1N1 vaccination in transplanted patients is relatively
      limited; to date, although some studies showed transient increases in alloreactivity, there
      is no evidence that H1N1 vaccines caused clinical rejection or organ dysfunction. In
      addition, studies have shown that influenza infection is a known independent risk factors
      for rejection. Considering that transplant recipients are a target population for
      immunisation with future pandemic vaccines, it is important to investigate the risk of
      rejection following vaccination in this patient population.

      Using the self-controlled case series design that allows to control implicitly for potential
      confounding factors, this study aims at investigating the risk of solid organ transplant
      rejection (liver, kidney, lung, heart, pancreas) following vaccination with Pandemrix™ in
      the United Kingdom Clinical Practice Research Datalink GP Online Database (CPRD GOLD). Data
      from the Hospital Episodes Statistics database will also be used. The effect of seasonal
      influenza vaccination and of various infections including influenza H1N1 will also be
      explored.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Subject defined as acceptable in the CPRD GOLD.

          -  Subject with at least one solid organ transplant rejection reported in the CPRD GOLD
             and/or HES during the overall study periods (01 September 2006 to 31 October 2010).

        Exclusion Criteria:

        •  Subject from HES matched to more than one subject in the CPRD GOLD.

study_pop.textblock:
Subject defined as acceptable in the CPRD GOLD with at least one solid organ transplant
        rejection reported during the overall study periods (01 September 2006 to 31 October
        2010).

intervention.description: Data extraction from the CPRD GOLD and HES, and additional data obtained from complementary information provided by the GPs using a standardised questionnaire.

clinical_study.official_title: Risk of Solid Organ Transplant Rejection Following Vaccination With Pandemrix™ in the United Kingdom

oversight_info.authority: United Kingdom: Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency

primary_outcome.description: Assessed by case data collection from CPRD GOLD and HES, and additional data obtained from complementary information provided by the GPs using a standardised questionnaire.
primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the risk of solid organ transplant rejection (liver, kidney, lung, heart, pancreas).
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within one month after vaccination with Pandemrix™ (from 01 October 2009 to 31 October 2010).

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by case data collection from CPRD GOLD and HES, and additional data obtained from complementary information provided by the GPs using a standardised questionnaire.
secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the risk of solid organ transplant rejection (liver, kidney, lung, heart, pancreas).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within two months after vaccination with Pandemrix™ ( from 01 October 2009 to 31 October 2010).
